body.name: PHILIPS 3000 Series Air Fryer Essential Compact with Rapid Air Technology, 13-in-1 Cooking Functions to Fry, Bake, Grill, Roast & Reheat with up to 90% Less Fat*, 4.1L capacity, Black (HD9252/91)

features: Bring home the Airfryer so you can have 100% taste satisfaction with crispy on the outside and tender on the inside results, using little to no added oil , with up to 90% less fat.

Crafted by our team of experts, who have been perfecting airfryer technology for over 10 years, its unique and patented “ starfish” design creates the fastest and most even results by allowing all food to be exposed to be exposed to constant, circulating heat allowing you to cook a variety of foods to a delicious, crispy result.

The air fryer can do more than just fry; it also grills, roasts, bakes and even reheats. The digital touch screen comes with 7 presets to make it easy to decide which temperature is best to cook your food and a keep warm function makes sure your food is ready when you are. Cook up to 4 portions (1.8lb/ 4.1L capacity) of food at once.

Unleash the full potential of your Philips Airfryer to cook meals that are tastier and healthier by downloading the Philips Kitchen app. Discover hundreds of tasty recipes and explore features to support, strengthen your cooking skills so you can make healthy homemade meals with ease.
body.description: The new Philips Essential Airfryer opens up a world of possibilities allowing you to cook your food to perfection every time no matter what you choose to make. Crafted by our team of experts who have been perfecting airfryer technology for over 10 years, its unique and patented “starfish” design, swirls hot air to create delicious foods using little to no added oil that are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with up to 90% less fat. The digital touch screen comes with 7 presets to make it easy to decide which temperature is best to cook your food and a keep warm function makes sure your food is ready when you are. The air fryer can do more than just fry; it also grills, roasts, bakes and even reheats! A small, compact design minimizes counter space, while still allowing the ability to cook up to 4 portions (1.8lb/4.1L capacity) of food. All removable parts are dishwasher safe and our Airfryer's QuickClean basket has a non-stick coating for easy cleaning. Frying with air also means your home will be free from the odor of traditional deep-frying. Unleash the full potential of your Philips Airfryer to cook meals that are tastier and healthier by downloading the Philips Kitchen app to discover hundreds of tasty recipes and explore features to strengthen your cooking skills and make homemade meals that you and your family love, every day. An included 1-year warranty helps maintain peace of mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great kitchen addition.
reviews.reviewText: I am usually cooking for 1 or 2 people and this works great. It is super simple to use, easy to clean and has consistent cooking results. If you are cooking for 3 or more, you might want something a bit larger. I am very happy with this unit and I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heats evenly, quite the bonus already, easy to use,
reviews.reviewText: one of the first things I noticed is how easy it is to separate the inner basket from the fryer container.The swirl pattern of the metal container is what I believe to be the complément parfait in air frying.The circulation of the air, especially underneath, is what makes these appliances so useful. Yet, cleaning the container takes a bit of attention, especially since there is a silicone grommet in the center. I attempted to reduce some of the cleaning requirement by ordering the Lotteli inserts, which I have unartfully trimmed to fit. Even without the inserts, the fryer is a godsend. cooks frozen french fries very well, heats leftover pizza perfectly, and I have even fried a burger from frozen in it (yet I prefer to use the iron skillet for meat; now that I discovered the manner to keep it perfectly non-stick).Getting the temp and time requirements sorted out is all trial and error. I have not used the kitchen+ app yet, and I have used Philips appliances prior and I trust the brand. it has a beeping alarm once it is finished, so bonus there. I have even put in bowls of chili or stew in it for quick heating (I detest the use of microwave for anything save popcorn). works well for that also. Highly recommended, and caught this on the Prime day sale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent brand and cooking tool
reviews.reviewText: Pros: healthy cooking, particularly effective with Fries, fish and chicken.Cons: small container. It takes some trial and error to find best temperature/time to get best results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good entry level air fryer
reviews.reviewText: My first air fryer. Good quality. Easy to use right out the box. Tray area is a bit small on this model size. Temp only goes up to 400° and some items I was cooking were recommended to use 450°. Power cord could be a bit longer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I didnt know I needed this!
reviews.reviewText: This is the best appliance I've bought that I didn't know I needed! I wanted something small because I don't have a lot of counter or storage space. I cook for one and love roasted vegetables and fish but don't like using the oven too often because propane is so expensive. This air fryer is perfect for me––it's compact, quiet, easy to clean and air fries veggies and fish beautifully. The basket may be too small for families, but it's just the right size for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Air Fyer
reviews.reviewText: My first air fryer and I love it. Perfect for small amounts to cook instead of heating up the whole big oven. Works great for frozen French fries and onion rings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Dream come true!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for an appliance to save heating up my oven in a small apartment during the summer months. It's already muggy where I live, and this air fryer is a marvel. It doesn't get as hot as my toaster! It's not just a fryer; in fact, I have not used it to fry anything, It is an air cooker. It cooks faster than an oven, and the food is excellent. There is an app with recipes to get you started. It is easy to use, easy to clean. So why didn't I give it five stars? For two reasons: (1) there is a terrible burnt plastic smell when you begin to use it. It is a toxic smell that can makesyou very sick. It does go away, but the appliance comes with no warning, and no suggestions for how to get rid of the smell. I looked on the internet and found two possible solutions, neither of which worked. (2) There is zero customer service. Because of the vile odor, I tried contacting Phillips. I tried the Chat function first, but gave up after 45 minutes waiting for an agent to come on line. I tried the telephone number several times. Finally, I reached someone who was aghast that I was having this problem. I don't know why she was so surprised, after all, it is discussed all over the internet! (And yes, I should have read the Amazon reviews more carefully before purchasing.) At any rate, she said she never heard of this, that it could be a safety issue, and that she was "expediting" the issue to the "team," and I would hear back within three to five business days. Yes, you are way ahead of me. I never heard back from the "team," or anyone else, except for an aggressive email from a Chat Agent who was apparently offended that I didn't wait longer than 45 minutes for someone to come to my aid, and who said, "unless I hear from you, I am closing this case." Case? What case? Of course, I wrote back immediately, and never heard from the Chat person again! So, long story short, unacceptable customer service is another reason for fewer stars. I find it difficult to have any confidence in a company when it provides no customer support. It tells me that Phillips does not stand behind its products, and buyer beware. If this air fryer survives the summer, I will consider myself lucky. And I will avoid Phillips products in the future.
Very pleased with this appliance as it is easy to use, produces tasty food and i should have gotten one much sooner.
The presets seem to be a bit useless and hard to navigate. Otherwise, works very well. Fish and meats are cooked evenly. Vegetables sometimes get burned on the edges.

This is a small appliance but suits my needs. I can cook a kilo of mushrooms, florets of a small cauliflower, two chicken breasts, etc.This is my second Philips Essential. I couldn’t figure out where to store the first one but came up with the “bright” idea to store it in my rarely used oven. I placed strips of cardboard over BAKE and START. This worked well until three weeks ago when I blithely pre-heated my oven to 400 degrees. Meltdown. Fortunately I did not set the oven on fire and had no noxious odour. I have created room for my new Philips Essential in a cupboard.

I owned the previous model of this air fryer and love it. So I bought this one as a gift to my mother in-law, since she love deep fried things I thought she would not like this so much and use it way less than I do. Well I was wrong she is loving it and the food cooked in it looks better than the previous model that I have, perhaps because of the easy set up and suggestive recipes on the display screen that makes easy than having to figure out the exactly temperature and time to cook each specific ingredients. The cons I have is that I can’t figure out how to change temperature to centigrade and the basket container is just the same size as my old one (maybe I should research the size better) any way this is a perfect and more compact upgrade from the previous model that is definitely worth buying.
